frameworks.name: Bloom's Taxonomy
frameworks.description: A framework for categorizing educational objectives into levels of complexity.

Application.description: Using new knowledge in practical applications.

Evaluation.description: Justifying a decision or course of action.

frameworks.name: SOLO Taxonomy
frameworks.description: A model describing levels of increasing complexity in understanding subjects.

Uni-structural.description: Simple and obvious connection, but limited understanding.

Multi-structural.description: Several related aspects, but they are seen as unrelated.

Relational.description: Integrated into a structure, understood in terms of its relevance.

Extended abstract.description: Generalized to new domain, reflecting on own understanding.

frameworks.name: Taxonomy of Significant Learning
frameworks.description: A framework for identifying significant learning experiences.

Foundational Knowledge.description: Understanding and remembering information and ideas.

Application.description: Skills in critical, creative, and practical thinking; managing projects.

Integration.description: Making connections between ideas, people, or realms of life.

Caring.description: Developing new feelings, interests, and values.

Learning How to Learn.description: Becoming a better student, inquiring about a subject.
